meanings.definition: Past tense of 'forgo': to do without; to give up
meanings.sent1: She forwent dessert to save room for the main course.
meanings.sent2: He forwent his usual morning coffee to try a new tea instead.
meanings.sent3: The cat forwent chasing the mouse and decided to take a nap instead.
meanings.sent4: The student forwent a night of fun to study for the important exam.
meanings.sent5: The athlete forwent social events to focus on training for the championship.

meanings.definition: Past tense of 'forego': to go before; to precede
meanings.sent1: The sunrise forwent the start of the morning jog.
meanings.sent2: The announcement forwent the beginning of the event.
meanings.sent3: The dessert forwent the main course and arrived first at the table.
meanings.sent4: The flower forwent the bloom of its neighboring plant.
meanings.sent5: The first star forwent the appearance of the night sky.
